result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohamad T Hamdan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohamad T Hamdan in court.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Mohamad T Hamdan.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status following 22CF3405. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mohamad T Hamdan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Mohamad T Hamdan.  Prosecuting attorney Dax Odom in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD Case in court for Scheduling Conference.
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF3405) in Branch 19 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorize transfer to Branch 19 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Walgreens - 275 W Wisconsin and John B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Mohamad T Hamdan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway appeared by video for Mohamad T Hamdan. Attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mohamad T Hamdan
Current: 1730 N 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205 United States  (Effective: 08-28-2022)
Prior: 3032 North 6th Street, #2, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Mohamad T Hamdan not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/30/2022
  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
